Support for most languages are ready with a Bengali distribution [[Ankur Bangla]], Tamil being included with quite a few Linux distributions with almost complete support and Hindi localization is also 90% complete.
Support for most languages are ready with a Bengali distribution [[Ankur Bangla]], Tamil being included with quite a few Linux distributions with almost complete support and Hindi localization is also 90% complete.
â
More languages are being pushed into mainstream distributions like [[Red Hat Linux]] which recently released [[Fedora Core|Fedora Core 3]] with complete support for Hindi, Bengali, Gujarati, Punjabi, and Tamil.{{Fact|date=June 2007}}
+
More languages are being pushed into mainstream distributions like [[Red Hat Linux]] which recently released [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora Core]] 3 with complete support for Hindi, Bengali, Gujarati, Punjabi, and Tamil.{{Fact|date=June 2007}}
There has been consistent updation of language related packages into other distributions like [[mandriva]], [[SuSE]], and [[Debian]] too through this group of volunteers.
There has been consistent updation of language related packages into other distributions like [[mandriva]], [[SuSE]], and [[Debian]] too through this group of volunteers.
